name: Multi-Batch Mode Implementation
observations: 4th generation mode added: 'multi-batch' (2-14 refs → batch output)
Distinct from 'multi-image' (2-14 refs → single blended output)
Tab label: 'Batch Generation' with Layers icon
Mode type added to GenerationMode union in supabase/types.ts
sequential_image_generation='auto' for multi-batch, 'disabled' for multi-image
Constraint: input refs + output images <= 15
BatchModeToggle hidden for multi-batch (always enabled)
Dedicated slider shown when >=2 images uploaded in multi-batch mode
Added defensive error handling in video-parameters.ts getMaxImagesForMode and getMinImagesForMode functions
Functions now throw clear error messages if invalid mode is passed at runtime
Build verified successful with TypeScript strict mode
Fixed runtime error: Added isVideoMode type guard in src/types/api.ts to check if UnifiedMode is a valid VideoMode
Updated page.tsx to conditionally render VideoUploadZone only when isVideo && isVideoMode(mode)
Prevents 'Invalid video mode: text' error when switching between image and video models
Added NEXT_PUBLIC_SEEDANCE_MODEL_ID environment variable to configure video model ID
Created .env.example file with all environment variables documented
Allows users to specify exact model ID from their Seedance account
Fixes 'model does not exist' errors when model name differs from account's activated model
Fixed video model 'does not exist' error by making model ID configurable
Changed VideoGenerationRequest.model type from literal 'seedance-1-5-pro' to string
Added NEXT_PUBLIC_SEEDANCE_MODEL_ID environment variable support
Created .env.example with documentation for video model configuration
User reports 'model or endpoint seedance-1-5-pro does not exist' error despite having model access
User confirms API key is set via frontend UI, not environment variables
VIDEO-GEN.md mentions 'endpoint ID' as alternative to model parameter
Error suggests either model name is wrong or endpoint ID should be used
Added optional custom video model ID feature to fix 'model does not exist' error
Added modelId parameter to SeedanceClient constructor and getSeedanceClient function
Updated VideoGenerationRequest type to include optional modelId field
Added UI input field in ApiKeySetup component for custom model ID (only shows for seedance-1-5-pro)
Input includes helper text: 'Only change this if you get a model does not exist error'
User can now override model ID (e.g., seedance-1-5-pro-251215) via API key setup panel

name: Batch Output Display Enhancements
observations: View mode toggle: slideshow vs grid view for batch results
Download All button for batch generations
Grid view: 2-4 columns with hover overlay for actions
Slideshow view: Embla carousel with thumbnail strip
AnimatePresence for smooth view mode transitions
handleDownloadAll: sequential downloads with 200ms delay
